page.title: 04Education: Rosneath
page.content: Rosneath Primary School is for all children from Rahane, Clynder and Rosneath. Since parents have been allowed to choose, two families from Kilcreggan and Coulport send their children here. Present school opened in l967 with roll of 127 rising to peak 259 and now 191. Old school at crossroads is used as Community Centre Headteacher is Miss E.L.MacKay, a native of Rosneath. Since school opened there have been 65 teachers. High level of mobility among staff and pupils due to posting of MOD personnel Present staff l Headteacher, 7 class teachers (4 of whom travel from Helensburgh), 1 part-time remedial teacher. One evening class per week for 'O' grade English.
